intro: Sida arguta, commonly known as desert mallow, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Americas. It is a herbaceous annual or perennial plant that typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm. The plant features alternate, ovate to lanceolate leaves with hairy surfaces, and produces small, yellowish flowers clustered in racemes. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Sida arguta is also known for its fibrous stems, which have been used in traditional practices.
